task.title: How to Add a Google+ Button in WebHelp Classic Output

context.p: To add a Google+ widget to your WebHelp output, follow these steps:

step.cmd: Go to the Google Developers website.

step.stepresult: The preview area on the right side displays the code and a preview of the widget.

step.cmd: Copy the code snippet displayed in the preview area and paste it into a div element inside an XML file called google-plus-button.xml.
step.info: Make sure that the content of the file is well-formed. The content of the XML file should look like this:

step.cmd: In , click the Configure Transformation Scenario(s) action from the toolbar (or the Document Transformation menu.

Select an existing WebHelp transformation scenario (depending on your needs, it may be with or without feedback, or the mobile variant) and click the Duplicate button to open the Edit Scenario dialog box.
Switch to the Parameters tab and edit the webhelp.footer.file parameter to reference the google-plus-button.xml file that you created earlier.
